header.title: Proposed Downgrading of Classified Documents for Cognitive Sciences Laboratory Volume 2 of 2 (U)

central_thesis: This compilation presents extensive scientific research conducted by the Cognitive Sciences Laboratory (primarily SRI International) on various aspects of remote viewing (RV) and other psi phenomena. The underlying scientific thesis is to rigorously investigate, develop, and validate methodologies for accessing and analyzing anomalous information, and to understand the mechanisms and influencing factors of these abilities, often with the implicit aim of demonstrating their operational utility and scientific legitimacy.

structure_content.chapter_title: An Application Oriented Remote Viewing Experiment (SRI Project 2740)
structure_content.summary: This report details an experiment evaluating remote viewing (RV) results using fuzzy set theory and assessing its applicability. A viewer (V372) described a microwave generator, with results analyzed for accuracy and reliability using fuzzy set comparison and a figure-of-merit, indicating significant success in identifying target elements despite some 'noise' in responses.

This study investigated the potential correlations between ambient geophysical and extremely low-frequency (ELF) electromagnetic factors and remote viewing performance. It explored environmental variables such as ELF intensity, geomagnetic indices, sunspot number, and solar flares, employing literature review, real-time ELF measurements, and computer correlation analyses to identify optimal performance conditions for RV.

This research explored computer-assisted methods for locating hidden or lost items, akin to 'dowsing.' Participants used a grid-based display system to find concealed targets, with immediate feedback provided. The experiments yielded statistically significant results in certain conditions, indicating a measurable success rate for psi-mediated searching in a structured environment.

structure_content.chapter_title: Special Orientation Techniques S-IV (U) and S-V, S-VI (U) (SRI Projects 5590 and 6600)
structure_content.summary: These reports describe advanced training and development programs designed to enhance remote viewing capabilities. They detail multi-stage, structured protocols (Stages I through VI) focused on improving RV precision, target acquisition skills, and the systematic reduction of 'noise.' The training progressively builds skills in sensory contact, dimensional/motor aspects, analytical overlays, and 3D modeling to yield more accurate and usable information.

key_concepts.definition: The acquisition and description, by mental means, of information blocked from ordinary perception by distance or shielding. It is a trainable anomalous cognition ability explored through rigorous scientific protocols.

A mathematical technique applied to remote viewing data to quantitatively compare target characteristics with viewer responses, allowing for degrees of membership rather than binary matching, thereby providing nuanced measures of accuracy and reliability in psi data.

A highly structured, multi-stage training and operational protocol for remote viewing, typically using geographical coordinates as initial target cues. It systematically guides viewers through progressive levels of perception and data acquisition, from basic ideograms to detailed sensory and analytical data.

A broad term used to describe direct interactions between human consciousness and the environment, encompassing phenomena like remote viewing, psychokinesis, and precognition, often investigated under a scientific framework.

The systematic process through which a remote viewer gains information about a designated target. This involves progressing through various perceptual and analytical stages to form increasingly detailed and accurate mental models of the target.

practical_system.description: The practical system elucidated through these reports is a highly structured, multi-faceted methodology for developing, training, and applying remote viewing (RV) and other psychoenergetic abilities. It prioritizes systematic data collection, rigorous experimental control, and quantitative evaluation. The core of the system involves isolating a viewer to perceive distant or concealed information, meticulously documenting their perceptions, and then analyzing the results against objective target data to reduce 'noise' and enhance reliability.
tools: Shielded Viewing Chambers: Specially constructed rooms designed to minimize sensory input and block electromagnetic interference.
Random Number Generators: Utilized for unbiased target selection and assignment, critical for maintaining double-blind experimental integrity.
Geographical Coordinates/Encrypted Data: Primary methods for presenting target information to remote viewers without revealing details.
Drawing and Writing Materials: Essential for viewers to physically record their perceptions during RV sessions.
Audio and Video Recording Equipment: Used to capture comprehensive data of RV sessions for later analysis and verification.
Computer-Assisted Search Systems: Interactive software and hardware used in specific experiments to facilitate target location and pattern recognition tasks for psi abilities.
Geophysical/ELF Monitoring Equipment: Instrumentation to measure environmental factors like extremely low-frequency electromagnetic fields, used to study their potential influence on RV performance.
Statistical Software and Fuzzy Set Algorithms: Computational tools for the rigorous quantitative analysis of RV data, including correlation analysis and figure-of-merit calculations.
Physiological Monitors: Devices (e.g., EEG, GSR) used to measure physiological responses during RV sessions to explore neurophysiological correlates of psi activity.
rituals: Viewer Isolation: Sequestration of the viewer in a soundproofed, electromagnetically shielded room to prevent sensory leakage and external cuing.
Targeting Protocol: Presentation of targets via random numbers, geographical coordinates, or sealed envelopes, ensuring strict double-blind conditions for the viewer.
Session Structure: Adherence to defined timeframes for the RV session, including distinct phases for initial impressions, detailed descriptions, and sketching.
Feedback Protocol: Implementation of controlled feedback mechanisms, ranging from no feedback to immediate or delayed target photo review, designed to calibrate and reinforce accurate perceptions.

Training Stages: Progressive engagement through structured training stages (e.g., S-I to S-VI in CRV) that systematically build skills in basic ideogram production, sensory contact, dimensional/motor perceptions, emotional/aesthetic responses, analytical overlays, and 3D modeling.
Data Recording: Comprehensive transcription of verbal responses, detailed logging of session observations, and collection of viewer sketches and drawings.

Data Analysis: Application of standardized scoring methodologies, statistical analysis, and fuzzy set theory for quantitative assessment of RV accuracy, reliability, and identification of significant correlations.

relevant_quotes.text: The objectives of this experiment were to: Demonstrate the potential of a novel collection technique, known as remote viewing.

Viewer V372 was asked to use RV to describe the activity of Project during August 24 and 25, 1988. He described approximately 80% of the identifiable target elements correctly, and 71% of his responses corresponded with the intended target. Although 29% noise remains, if this experiment had been an actual activity, the noise probably would not have been a significant distracting factor.
The objective of this effort is to investigate the possible effects of ambient geophysical/extremely low-frequency electromagnetic factors on remote viewing (RV) performance.

The next stage was to administer the same tests to all SRI, and Mobius Society personnel currently involved in RV. On the basis of the test results, predictions were made as to the individuals' RV abilities.

critical_analysis.relevance: This compilation is profoundly relevant to Western Esotericism and Occultism by providing a rare scientific, government-funded exploration of phenomena traditionally considered esoteric, such as clairvoyance and scrying. It attempts to demystify and systematize psi abilities, offering empirical data and rigorous methodologies (e.g., fuzzy sets, statistical analysis, controlled protocols) that contrast with, yet also illuminate, traditional subjective occult experiences. The work bridges the gap between scientific inquiry and anomalous consciousness, providing a valuable resource for those seeking to understand or develop psi abilities through a structured, operative lens.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary target audience includes scientific researchers in parapsychology, cognitive science, and physics; government intelligence agencies (for whom these documents were originally classified); and practitioners and theorists within the esoteric and occult communities interested in empirical data and structured methodologies for psi development. It also appeals to anyone intrigued by the scientific investigation of consciousness and anomalous phenomena.
